intro: Dysosma tsayuensis, commonly known as the Yunnan dysosma, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Dysosma tsayuensis is also notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
